page.title: 02Nethertown of Croys
page.content: Nethertown of Croys is a farm which is a part of three farms. The three farms work as one and all help each other with animals and crops. Nethertown of Croys used to be a dairy farm, but when Mr and Mrs Hutton moved in they turned it into a beef farm. Nethertown of Croys is 200 acres. They use this for grazing cattle and growing crops. Their main crop is oats. It is used to feed the cattle. The breed of cattle they have are Galloways and they have a few Hereford cattle. There are over one hundred cattle. Mrs Hutton and her daughter Jennifer have two horses but purely for pleasure. Mr and Mrs Hutton do not actually own the farm. They rent it from Mr Keswick who lives in Bridge of Urr.
